topic.title: Preparing storage for the master host

body.p: In addition to the storage required for its operating system, a master host requires the following storage areas:

ul.li: A local partition for Docker data, configured as an LVM thin pool.

A local partition for internal services data, formatted with the XFS filesystem.
internal services include ZooKeeper, which requires consistently fast storage. recommends using a separate, high-performance storage resource for internal services. For example, a drive that is configured with only one primary partition, which eliminates contention by other services.
A local or remote primary partition for data, configured as an LVM thin pool.

A local primary partition, a remote primary partition, or a remote file server, for backups of data. The local or remote primary partition is formatted with the XFS filesystem. A remote file server must provide a filesystem that is compatible with XFS. If you are using a primary partition on a local device for backups, ensure that the primary partition for internal services data is not on the same device.
